title: 1985–86 Cypriot First Division
text:
The 1985–86 Cypriot First Division was the 47th season of the Cypriot top-level <a href="Association%20football">football</a> league. <a href="APOEL%20FC">APOEL</a> won their 13th title. 
Format.
Fourteen teams participated in the 1985–86 Cypriot First Division. All teams played against each other twice, once at their home and once away. The team with the most points at the end of the season crowned champions. No team was relegated to the <a href="1986%E2%80%9387%20Cypriot%20Second%20Division">1986–87 Cypriot Second Division</a>.
The champions ensured their participation in the <a href="1986%E2%80%9387%20European%20Cup">1986–87 European Cup</a> and the runners-up in the <a href="1986%E2%80%9387%20UEFA%20Cup">1986–87 UEFA Cup</a>.
Changes from previous season.
<a href="Omonia%20Aradippou">Omonia Aradippou</a> and <a href="Evagoras%20Paphos">Evagoras Paphos</a> were relegated from previous season and played in the <a href="1985%E2%80%9386%20Cypriot%20Second%20Division">1985–86 Cypriot Second Division</a>. They were replaced by the first two teams of the <a href="1984%E2%80%9385%20Cypriot%20Second%20Division">1984–85 Cypriot Second Division</a>, <a href="Ermis%20Aradippou">Ermis Aradippou</a> and <a href="APOP%20Paphos">APOP Paphos</a>.
